text:
I have recently upgraded from 1.4.1 to 1.5.1.  I have noticed now that whey 
trying to build our EJB JARs I get out of memory errors from ant.  I can revert 
back to 1.4.1 and the build works fine.

<!-- target from build.xml file -->
    <target name="makeWeblogicJAR" depends="init,makeJAR">
        <java classname="weblogic.ejbc" fork="yes" failonerror="yes"
            args="-compiler javac ${cbmrdbms.jardir}/std${cbmrdbms.jar} 
${cbmrdbms.libdir}/bfi/${cbmrdbms.jar}">
            <classpath refid="cbmrdbms.classpath" />
        </java>
        <delete file="${cbmrdbms.jardir}/std${cbmrdbms.jar}"/>
    </target>

creator: conor@apache.org
text:
Since you are using java to run weblogic.ejbc, you can specify more memory using
the maxmemory attribute. I'm not sure why changing from 1.4.1 to 1.5.1 would
cause this, but the maxmemory should fix it.
